title: Sparta Prague's Michal Sacek scores unfortunate own goal with his backside in derby defeat
text:
Sparta Prague midfielder Michal Sacek was left red-faced after scoring an unfortunate own goal in his side's derby defeat against Slavia.

With the hosts already a goal down and having failed to clear their lines, a hurried effort inside the box comically deflected off Sacek's backside before dropping into the net.

Sparta were resoundingly defeated 3-0 - with the bizarre own goal rounding off a poor afternoon for Vaclav Jilek's men in the eagerly-awaited clash.

Sparta Prague midfielder Michal Sacek was left red-faced after an unfortunate own goal

There are own-goals, and then there are own-goals that go in off your arse...pic.twitter.com/cNaQ67JQJj — Who Ate All The Pies (@waatpies) September 23, 2019

Praha continued their flying start to the campaign at the home of their city neighbours with a fourth victory in their last five league games.

But after edging in front through a spot kick in the first half on Sunday, the visitors were forced to rely on a substantial piece of luck after the break to double their lead.

Following a scramble inside the box, striker Peter Olayinka looked to drive a shot through a crowd of bodies.

And in a comical few moments, the strike bounced off Sacek, who was left grounded after a challenge just yards in front of the goal mouth, and deceived goalkeeper Milan Heca.

A hurried strike inside the penalty area resulted in a wicked deflection off Sacek's backside

The home side had fallen to a 3-0 defeat in the derby to the Czech top division's league leaders

The Prague derby is a notoriously feisty affair, with Sparta holding the advantage over their rivals in the 294 previous meetings.

But in recent history, it has been Slavia who typically dominate at the summit of the league - and Jindrich Trpisovsky's men clinched the title last season after finishing five points clear.

The second derby of the domestic campaign is set to take place on March 7.
